alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 10:37PM CDT until July 05 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following counties, Franklin and Webster. * WHEN...Until 315 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and creeks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1036 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in areas along and south of State Highway 4. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Areas along and south of State Highway 4 is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Blue Hill, Campbell, Bladen, Riverton, Cowles, Inavale and Rosemont.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
